remarks: Define a quantity whose definition involves a choice of representative, but which is uniquely determined regardless of the choice.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 1-Jun-2011.)
statement:
unirep.1 $e |- ( y = D -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
unirep.2 $e |- ( y = D -> B = C ) $.
unirep.3 $e |- ( y = z -> ( ph <-> ch ) ) $.
unirep.4 $e |- ( y = z -> B = F ) $.
unirep.5 $e |- B e. _V $.
unirep $p |- ( ( A. y e. A A. z e. A ( ( ph /\ ch ) -> B = F ) /\ ( D e. A /\ ps ) ) -> ( iota x E. y e. A ( ph /\ x = B ) ) = C ) $.
$d A x y z $.
$d B x z $.
$d C x y $.
$d D x y $.
$d F x y $.
$d ch x y $.
$d ph x z $.
$d ps x y $.
